info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 6:32PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hidalgo County through 700 PM MDT... At 631 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Lordsburg, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and potential visibility reduction from blowing dust and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lordsburg, Cotton City, Steins, Road Forks, Lordsburg Playa, Pyramid Mountains and Shakespeare. This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
